history.content:
There appears to be is a lag time >24 hours between when the campus systems are updated.

If you were enrolled off the waitlist, you should see that you are indeed enrolled.

If you see that you're on the waitlist, you are still on the waitlist, and should plan for a backup course.

"But what is my real waitlist position?"

  • Sadly, we're not able to check everyone's actual waitlist positions. I suspect you'll find out in 48? hours. 
  • You can probably do a rough estimate of what your waitlist # is by taking your waitlist number and subtract how many people were enrolled into the course. ie i'm # 150 and 120 people got off the waitlist, I'm probably about #30. 

I'm sorry it's stressful, and frustrating. The new SIS project is supposedly going to solve these problems. *cross fingers*
history.subject: why is my waitlist position > the # of people on the waitlist?
